intro: Hibbertia scandens, commonly known as the climbing hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its trailing or climbing growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Hibbertia scandens thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
